title: Worldwide computer breakdown: airports, banks and hospitals disrupted by the biggest computer failure in history
summary: A software update from CrowdStrike, affecting Microsoft Windows computers, caused havoc for businesses across the world.

title: Israel's occupation of Palestinian territory is 'illegal' according to top UN court
summary: The International Court of Justice's legal opinions are not binding, but they do carry considerable political weight.

title: Who is Yaël Braun-Privet, the re-elected president of France's Assemblée Nationale?
summary: The member of French President Emmanuel Macron's Rennaissance party, a lawyer in her pre-political life, was re-elected on Thursday.

title: Macron keeps promise to swim in Seine, but 'not necessarily' before Paris Olympics
summary: A spokesperson for President Macron asserted to reporters on Friday, July 19, that Macron has consistently expressed this conviction, though he may not find the opportunity to do so before the Games' opening ceremony due to scheduling constraints.

title: Paris 2024: City's homeless 'made invisible' after camp evictions
summary: Authorities have denied that camp closures are linked to the Olympics, but a collective of homeless organizations have expressed disappointment when it comes to the promise of a 'social legacy' from the Games.

title: At the Fondation Vincent Van Gogh Arles, artists are reaching for the stars
summary: The "Van Gogh and the Stars" exhibition, rich with revelations and correlations, delves into the interplay between art and astronomical advancements.

title: Trump spoke with Zelensky, pledging to 'end the war'
summary: Former American President Donald Trump, who on Thursday formally accepted the Republican Party's presidential nomination, has repeatedly claimed he would end the war very quickly, without offering details as to how.

title: Democratic voters in Arizona divided over Biden's presidential bid
summary: While many political leaders, including Barack Obama, have expressed doubts about the viability of a Joe Biden candidacy, Democrat supporters on the ground seem more divided.

title: Tunisian President Kais Saied announces bid for reelection amidst turbulent first term
summary: The birthplace of the 'Arab Spring' has become, under Saied's presidency, the scene of an authoritarian toughening, raising fears of a return to dictatorial practices.

title: Greek companies are tempted by the six-day workweek
summary: Since July 1, a law has allowed certain companies to make their employees work 48 hours over six days or two hours overtime over five days. The unions are mobilizing.

title: Pogacar wins 19th stage to close on Tour de France triumph
summary: Tadej Pogacar overtook three riders on the final 16-kilometer climb to win the nineteenth stage of the Tour de France on Friday.

title: US to phase out federal usage of single-use plastics by 2035
summary: The World Wildlife Fund has warned that unless governments reach an ambitious agreement with legally binding rules, global plastic pollution is set to triple by 2040.

title: Megabasins: What's the latest in the water reservoir rush?
summary: The outgoing French government has shown its willingness to develop agricultural hydraulics. But courts have frequently overturned prefectures' water withdrawal authorizations.

title: Anti-left front emerges as Macron-backed candidate re-elected as Assemblée Nationale president
summary: Yaël Braun-Pivet, president of the Assemblée Nationale, was re-elected on Thursday against left-wing candidate André Chassaigne and far-right candidate Sébastien Chenu. She called for 'new methods'... just as she did in 2022.

title: City of Paris takes legal action against 'flying taxis' during Olympic Games
summary: The city, alongside other organizations, is challenging the French government's authorization of a helicopter taxi project, calling it 'an environmental aberration for the ultra-rich'.

title: Paris 2024: Behind the scenes of the International Broadcast Center, the Olympics' media heart
summary: The International Broadcast Center will host between 8,000 and 10,000 journalists every day. All images and sound from the competition will transit through this highly secure site.

title: Paris knife attacker suspected of killing teenager
summary: A policeman was wounded with a knife on Thursday near the Champs-Elysées. According to police sources, the attacker, who was shot dead by a policeman, is suspected of having committed a murder in a Paris suburb on the same day.

title: India's infrastructures are collapsing one after the other
summary: Several airports and bridges have collapsed, mainly due to rainfall, while the country is building at breakneck speed to maintain its development.

title: Adidas drops Bella Hadid from campaign over Gaza controversy
summary: Adidas dropped vocal pro-Palestinian model Bella Hadid from an advertising campaign for vintage Olympics-inspired sneakers.

title: Green votes secure Ursula von der Leyen re-election as president of the European Commission
summary: Ursula von der Leyen was reappointed with 401 votes, managing to garner support from the European Greens (apart from French MEPs). But she had to contend with defections from her European People's Party camp, notably from the French LR party.

title: Death is their calling: Young people increasingly dream of becoming embalmers
summary: More and more families, when faced with the death of a loved one, are opting to have them embalmed. The professions associated with this new, highly regulated ceremonial practice are attracting young people.

title: Paris 2024: QR codes and anti-terror zones transform city center
summary: From July 18, traffic around the Seine in central Paris, the site of the Olympic Games opening ceremony on July 26, is being significantly restricted.

title: Where to sleep in Paris? A map of Le Monde's top 25 addresses
summary: On vacation in the capital or in the Paris region? Here is our selection of hotels and hostels in interactive map format.
